item.title: Php Wrappers
item.description: Detailed Note on Remote Code Execution (RCE) Using PHP Wrappers PHP wrappers are special streams provided by PHP to handle data in different ways. Attackers exploit them to achieve Remote Code Execution (RCE) when the target application lacks sufficient input sanitization or proper configuration. Below is a detailed explanation of how some PHP wrappers (expect, data, php://input, and allow_url_include) are used in RCE attacks. 1. The expect Wrapper What It Does The expect wrapper allows execution of shell commands directly from PHP.

item.title: Annie Ctf
item.description: This lab was relativey simple but taught me a lot of things Enumeration The thing I like to do is find all the open ports with rustscan and then run nmap for futher analysis, it makes my thing faster by about 10 minutes. So I ran these following commands rustscan -a $ip -b 65535 -u 5000 | tee rustscan Then I run nmap on the found ports sudo nmap $ip -p xxx,xxx -sV -sC I saw that two ports were open, One was ssh on 22 and real server on 7070

item.title: About
item.description: About Me Hello you, welcome to my Website. I’m Sairas, a penetration tester & an active member of NCA@Nepal. This is where I share my thoughts, experiences, and projects. Feel free to explore my posts and reach out if you’d like to connect! Intrested in: Web Application Security Penetration Testing Python Programming Rust Programming Reverse Engineering/PWN Assembly Language
